definition: happy/glad/willing (to do sth)/in a cheerful mood
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
cheerful and optimistic/in a good mood/gaily

sentences.english: "I'm so glad to see you, " said Carrie, pleased and yet nonplussed.
sentences.chinese: “看見你我太高興了，”嘉莉說，既高興又爲難。

sentences.english: "I'm so glad to see you, " said Carrie, pleased and yet nonplussed.
sentences.chinese: “看見你我太高興了，”嘉莉說，既高興又爲難。

sentences.english: You know, Uncle Brendan, I am really glad you invited me here.
sentences.chinese: 你知道，布萊登叔叔，我真的很高興你邀請我們來。

sentences.english: It did my heart good to hear about your promotion to Vice President of the agency.
sentences.chinese: 得知你提升爲經銷處副總經理，我心裏特別高興。

sentences.english: It's great that we're seeing such community spirit sweeping the nation.
sentences.chinese: 這種社區精神遍及全英，真讓人高興。

sentences.english: Don't be too happy to forget yourself.
It is research that is guaranteed to delight men - and infuriate the women in their lives.
sentences.chinese: 這項研究結果一定會讓男人高興，惹女人生氣。

sentences.english: I'm very pleased to meet you, the matron said, I'm his mother!
sentences.chinese: 很高興認識你，護士長說，我是他的母親。

sentences.english: He cheerfully went off to school.
sentences.chinese: 他高高興興地上學去了。

sentences.english: The Glee Club decided to present an oratorio during their recital.
sentences.chinese: 高興俱樂部的決定提出的清唱劇在其演奏。

sentences.english: The hunchback in the corner by the wall exulted.
sentences.chinese: 壁角的駝背忽然高興起來。

sentences.english: I take pleasure in recommending to you Mr. Li Yan.
sentences.chinese: 我很高興地向您推薦李巖先生。

sentences.english: It was very nice that the drivers called us "little Lei Feng"
sentences.chinese: 最讓人高興的是，司機叔叔稱我們是小雷鋒。

sentences.english: She was glad to be on land again.
sentences.chinese: 她很高興又回到陸地了。

sentences.english: Southern leaders were pleased with the anti-war movement in the North.
sentences.chinese: 南方領導人很高興地看到北方的反戰運動。

sentences.english: "There is no talk of capitulation, everybody's really happy, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “沒有任何妥協的談判，每個人都非常高興”他說到。

definition: to feel happy/to rejoice/to have a great time/to make fun of sb
to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
to be willing to do sth/to be ready to do sth/to be happy to do sth/content/satisfied
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
to grieve/to be broken-hearted/to feel deeply hurt
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
to feel embarrassed or awkward/to make things difficult (for someone)/to find things difficult (to do or manage)
